column4: Hi, everyone, I'm trying to mirror the Ubuntu amd64 repositories. I want to download the repositories and then transfer them as they are to another computer which will host them. I don't want to host them on the same computer as I'm downloading them on.
I know of apt-mirror, debmirror and using rsync to mirror but I don't know which is the best for what I want to do.
Any suggestions?
depends on your purpose
so you are looking for a sort of local repository for your LAN?
so rsync is not really what you'd be wanting
what /me'd do in such a situation is pull down all the packages from net on the cafe, carry them over to the college computer) and create a local repository from it
the only downside is the local repository won't really offer up-to-date updates like the official mirrors, but since ur college net is bad anyway, /me don't think that will be a problem
This is the part I'm unsure about. I was wondering which of apt-mirror and debmirror to use since all documentation I can find regarding both dates back to 2006-7.
none of apt-mirror or debmirror will suit the purpose if you decide to follow my idea of creating a local repo
I see, then how do I ensure I only download amd64 packages?
u can use any of those tools (including rsync) to just pull down the packages...but for the rest of the process none of them would be of much help
I see. Do you know of an existing script to simplify downloading all packages of a particular architecture?
why not create your own? Shouldn't be much hard, using wget+sed :P
:) I could try that but considering I have no idea how to use sed, it would require me to learn quite a bit just to do one task.
then just use apt-mirror to download the packages on your cafe machine. You can worry about the rest of process later
as it is, the rest (creating a local repo) is not very difficult
I can just move over the repository files once it downloads?
yes, but make sure it downloads ALL the packages (don't interrupt it midway e.g)
Very well, sayanriju. Thank you. I will use apt-mirror.

and in case you need help creating the local mirror, u can see my blog post at http://blog.sayanriju.co.cc/2009/07/31/using-a-local-ubuntu-repository-to-avoid-redownloading-packages-on-a-reinstall/ (shameless self advertising :)
What a useful coincidence that you posted on just that! Bookmarked for later.
